wavemedia.graphic

Class GraphicsHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • wavemedia.graphic.GraphicsHandler

  • public class GraphicsHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to handle multiple graphics at once.
    Version:
    1.0 13/04/2015
    Author:
    tjd511

    • Method Detail

      • createGraphic

        public void createGraphic(GraphicHandlerObject graphicObject)
        Method creates a new graphic, and draws it on the group specified in the constructor.
        Parameters:
        graphicObject - a graphics object containing all the information about the graphic to be drawn. Must be formed using the GraphicBuilder.
        See Also:
        graphicsHandler.GraphicHandlerObject}

      • setVisible

        public void setVisible(int graphicNumber,
              boolean visible)
        Method toggles the visibility of a graphic.
        Parameters:
        graphicNumber - the index of the graphic to be changed
        visible - boolean containing the state of the visibility of the graphic

      • sendToBack

        public void sendToBack(int graphicNumber)
        Method to send a particular graphic to the back of the group.
        Parameters:
        graphicNumber - the index of the graphic to be sent to back

      • sendToFront

        public void sendToFront(int graphicNumber)
        Method to send a particular graphic to the front of the group.
        Parameters:
        graphicNumber - the index of the graphic to be sent to front

      • getGraphicCount

        public int getGraphicCount()
        Method gets the number of graphics.
        Returns:
        the current number of instantiated graphics

      • clearGraphics

        public void clearGraphics()
        Method clears the current array of graphics
